subject: Re: Problems with New JUnit 3.6 and HTTPUnit
msgSnippet: Hi, I had the same error with JTidy-04aug2000r6 + HttpUnit-1.2.3 + JUnit- 3.5 and I solved it by recompiling HttpUnit after adding to ... It seems there is a
messageBody:
Hi,

I had the same error with JTidy-04aug2000r6 + HttpUnit-1.2.3 + JUnit-
3.5 and I solved it by recompiling HttpUnit after adding to
ReceivedPage.java in getParser() method :
> tidy.setXmlTags( true );

It seems there is a problem between HTML and XML parsing...

This is discussed in https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?
func=detail&aid=231787&group_id=13153&atid=113153.

q1 : why didn't you have this pb with JUnit 3.5 ?
q2 : is the '20 Dec 2000' release of JTidy the same than mine ?

Hope this helps...


Yann


--- In junit@y..., Brian Button <bbutton01@e...> wrote:
> >>>>> "Paul" == Paul Hodgetts <prh@z...> writes:
>
> Paul> Using the new JUnit 3.6, along with the latest HTTPUnit
> Paul> 1.2.3 and JTidy (20 Dec 2000), we get the following
> Paul> exception when trying to run some servlet unit tests:
>
> Paul> java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access field
> Paul> org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl._parseHead from class
> Paul> org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl$ParseHTML
>
> Paul> We haven't had a chance to debug this yet, but it seems
some
> Paul> sort of incompatibility was introduced in Junit 3.6.
JUnit
> Paul> 3.5 works fine.
>
> Paul> Any ideas as to what might be going on?
>
> Hi, Paul,
>
> Did you try unchecking the box about reloading classes? I'm sure you
> have, but it is worth mentioning. This behavior looks like what we
saw
> previously when we upgraded to 3.5 this past February.
>
> bab
>
>
> --
> Brian Button bbutton@o...
> Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc
> St. Louis, MO http://www.objectmentor.com
